sentence.Network_en: Insurance companies are trying to recoup their losses by increasing premiums.
sentence.Network_cn: 保险公司正试图通过提高保费来弥补损失。

sentence.Network_en: We hope to recoup our initial investment in the first year.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们希望我们的前期投资在第一年就能赚回来。

sentence.Network_en: It took the firm five years to recoup its losses.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个公司5年后才挽回损失.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (as a legal term): from French recouper 'retrench, cut back', from re- 'back' + couper 'to cut'

entry.tran: 重新获得;重新拿回;收回;弥补
entry.def: If you recoup a sum of money that you have spent or lost, you get it back.

example.ex: Insurance companies are trying to recoup their losses by increasing premiums.
example.tran: 保险公司正试图通过提高保费来弥补损失。

means.word_mean: 1. reimburse or compensate (someone), as for a loss
3. retain and refrain from disbursing; of payments;

sentences.en: It took the firm five years to recoup its losses.
sentences.cn: 这个公司5 年后才挽回损失。

sentences.en: The company has been forced to sell land to recoup some of the losses.
sentences.cn: 公司被迫出售土地以弥补部分损失。

sentences.en: It took two years before I recouped my investment.
sentences.cn: 我用了两年时间才收回投资。

sentences.en: He recouped his train fares from his employers.
sentences.cn: 他向老板报销了他的车费。
